member.name: Windows.DEFINE_PROPERTYKEY
member.summary: Used to pack a format identifier (FMTID) and property identifier (PID) into a structure that represents a property key.
member.param: The name of a structure that represents a property key.
The value of the Data1 member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data2 member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data3 member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[0] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[1] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[2] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[3] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[4] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[5] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[6] member of the fmtid member of the structure.
The value of the Data4[7] member of the fmtid member of the structure.

param.name: pid
param.para: A property identifier (PID). It is recommended that you set this value to PID_FIRST_USABLE. Any value greater than or equal to 2 is acceptable.
param.div: Note Values of 0 and 1 are reserved and should not be used.

member.name: Windows.IsEqualPropertyKey
member.summary: Compares the members of two structures and returns whether they are equal.
